intro: Psychotria pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, including parts of Mexico and the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria pacifica is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
